means: 分离的，被分割的，分裂的
分( divide的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: This issue, more than any other, has divided her cabinet.
sentence.Network_cn: 主要是这一问题使她的内阁产生了分歧。

sentence.Network_en: Sixteen teams are taking part, divided into four groups.
The Roman Empire was divided in the fourth century AD.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗马帝国于公元4世纪分裂。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《Friends》词汇表A ... menus n. 菜单 divided adj. 分开的 calculator n. 计算机, 计算器.
WE&nbsp;2011&nbsp;上海&nbsp;百联世茂国际购... ... 男装 men's clothing 青少年装 divided 牛仔系列 jeans.
democracy is divided as direct democracy and indirect democracy ., 民主可分为直接民主和间接民主.
最新《中考冲刺词汇》第三课 ... dive 潜水 divided 分开的，分裂的 doesn't 不.

list.abs: 进出口行业词汇英语翻译(D) ... divider with sheath 附套两脚规 divider 除法器 dividing and cutting machine 分切机.
忖字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 同本义〖 ponder;speculate〗 除〖 divide〗 心中忖量〖 guess〗.
分字的解释---在线新华字典 ... 分局〖 suboffice;subbureau〗 分开〖 separate;divide〗 分科〖 departmentation〗.

entry.def: When people or things are divided or divide into smaller groups or parts, they become separated into smaller parts.

example.ex: The physical benefits of exercise can be divided into three factors...
example.tran: 运动对身体的好处可以分为3个方面。

example.ex: It will be easiest if we divide them into groups...
example.tran: 如果我们将他们分成小组将是最简单的。

entry.def: If you divide something among people or things, you separate it into several parts or quantities which you distribute to the people or things.

example.ex: Paul divides most of his spare time between the study and his bedroom...
example.tran: 保罗在大部分空闲时间里要么呆在书房里，要么呆在卧室里。
把酱汁分到 4 个碗里。

entry.def: If you divide a larger number by a smaller number or divide a smaller number into a larger number, you calculate how many times the smaller number can fit exactly into the larger number.

example.ex: Measure the floor area of the greenhouse and divide it by six.
example.tran: 量一下温室的建筑面积再将它除以 6。

entry.tran: 分隔;把…分开;是…的分界线
entry.def: If a border or line divides two areas or divides an area into two, it keeps the two areas separate from each other.

example.ex: ...remote border areas dividing Tamil and Muslim settlements.
example.tran: 将泰米尔聚居区和穆斯林聚居区隔开的偏远边境地区

example.ex: ...the artificial line that divides the city.
example.tran: 划分城市的人为分界线

entry.def: If people divide over something or if something divides them, it causes strong disagreement between them.

example.ex: She has done more to divide the Conservatives than anyone else...
example.tran: 她在分裂保守党这件事上所起的作用比任何人都大。

example.ex: The democrats are divided over whether to admit him into their group...
example.tran: 民主党人就是否允许他加入他们的组织意见不一。

entry.tran: 明显差异;(常指引起争论的)分歧
entry.def: A divide is a significant distinction between two groups, often one that causes conflict.

example.ex: ...a deliberate attempt to create a Hindu-Muslim divide in India.
example.tran: 故意在印度的印度教徒和穆斯林之间制造分歧的企图

entry.def: A divide is a moment in time or a point in a process when there is a complete change from one situation to another.

example.ex: The time had come to cross the great divide between formality and truth.
example.tran: 是时候跨越形式与真理之间的巨大分界线了。

entry.def: A divide is a line of high ground between areas that are drained by different rivers.
You use divide and rule to refer to a policy which is intended to keep someone in a position of power by causing disagreements between people who might otherwise unite against them.

example.ex: The government's policies of divide and rule have only contributed to the volatility of the region.
example.tran: 政府分而治之的政策只是加剧了该地区的不稳定性。

means.word_mean: 2. having a median strip or island between lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions;
3. distributed in portions (often equal) on the basis of a plan or purpose

auth_sentence.content: We are saying the country needs to be divided.

Sentence.sentence: The big change is the availability of more data about people and things, which allows physical assets to be divided and consumed as services.

Based on answers to questions regarding their job hunting strategies and career decisions, he divided the students into two groups: maximizers, who consider every possible option, and satisficers, who look until they find an option that is good enough.

means.word_mean: 分离的;被分割的;分裂的

sentences.en: Europe is divided into economic zones.
Canada is divided into 10 provinces and 2 territories.
sentences.cn: 加拿大分为十个省和两个区。

sentences.en: Berlin was divided into four sectors after the war.
sentences.cn: 战后柏林分成了4 个区。
